name: Rosa I. Arriaga
content: Rosa I. Arriaga, PhDSearch this siteEmbedded FilesSkip to main contentSkip to navigationAssociate ProfessorDirector, Ubicomp Health and Wellness LabInteractive Computing, Georgia TechCV,  New AI Grant to support future work in clinical training!, GoogleScholar's Page Listen to a recent talk, podcast about her research on Tech and PTSD or views on graduate educationDr. Arriaga is a Human Computer Interaction (HCI) researcher in the School of Interactive Computing. She uses psychological concepts and theories to address fundamental topics of Human Computer Interaction and Social Computing. Her current research interests are in the area of chronic care management and mental health. She designs mHealth systems that address gaps in chronic care and mental health management. The computational systems she designs:foster engagement facilitate continuity of care mediate communication between patient and healthcare providers (both formal and informal)promote patient self-advocacyShe teaches undergraduate courses in the People and Intelligence Threads and graduate courses in HCI and Human Centered Computing (HCC). You can take her  Intro to User Experience Design GT-COURSERA COURSE for free (over 61K learners have completed the course, as of 9/2025).As an administrator one of her foci is improving graduate students’ health and wellness by advocating self-care that is in unison with their academic goals and activities. Google SitesReport abusePage detailsPage updated Google SitesReport abuse
